text:
My most memorable memory with my dad was when I was a kid, my dad had always encouraged and supported me in drawing competition. He knew that I love arts, so he bought me lots of drawing and colouring tools and taught me drawing skills. My dad accompanied me in every art competitions on weekend and I love the moral support he gave me. After each competition, my dad bought me my favourite foods 😃😋and I truly enjoyed and grateful for every moment I spent with him.❤
My everything is my dad as he is the pillar of strength. He makes me smile when times are low. He know us better than anyone else. He is always be there to encourage us. His life lesson is valuable guidance to us. It is his faith and trusts in me, that I had crossed so many difficult boundaries. 
I love you very much, dad! ❤😃. Happy Father's Day ❤😃
Liked and shared
@yeohyeoh8 @shannon_883 @cofimiao

My superpower dad like IRONMAN who is able to cook delicious meal for us regardless if it’s Chinese, Japanese or Korean. Nothing can stop him from challenging new recipes! He’s also our technician and plumber at home to fix our lights and toilet sink whenever it broke down 💪. He’s strong in building and fixing our little one’s furniture and baby cot! ❤️ I always have the best! 💕 @pengannsiow @salina_bellona @juslingchen

Thanks for the awesome giveaway by Liminal! Father's Day is nearing soon! I am so proud of my daddy. He is a man of few words, generous, loving and someone who is righteous. His love for the family is often unspoken and undeniable as he will quietly work hard and persevere even when the burden took a toil on him. His love is always catered for his own brothers and the family. I feel heartpain for him as most of the work burdens are on him. His brothers took up minority of the work. He will always go to his workplace every night and sleep for 3 to 4 hours before his goods arrive, to prepare, and to handle most of the crowds by himself. He has to brave through cold blowing wind every night too. As time pass, his health is not as healthy as before. As a daughter, there is nothing much i can do than giving him the best that i can. I feel thankful for his selfless love, love us abundantly, his care and concern. His undivided love for his daughters. I cannot wait to keep my parents safe and protected at their home sweet home. My way of loving him - I love you daddy! Happy Father's Day! @susantan1506 @susanglc @salina_bellona  FB: Bycl Lim

My most treasured memory with my dad is the incident that made me realise he's a cool cucumber and that I should aspire to be like him 😊 When I was younger, I used to be extremely afraid of getting into trouble with my parents. So one time, when I accidentally dropped a glass and spilt its sweet contents all over the floor at home, I immediately froze out of fear and broke into tears just imagining the scolding I was going to get from mom. She would be LIVID and start on her tirade about how I was so careless and that the ants would come etc. However, before mom arrived at the scene of my "crime", dad came to my rescue! He calmly told me to wipe away my tears and think about what we should do next to clean up the mess. Together, we quietly worked through sweeping up the glass shards and mopping up the liquid - not once did he berate me about the accident. That day, I learned that when faced with a bad situation, do not panic; instead, be practical! Take a breath and think of the possible solutions instead of being overwhelmed by your emotions. It's a lesson I practise to this day, and that I hope to pass on to my own children in the future! 😊

My fondest memories experience 💖💖with my dad and family was a Taiwan trip with them that we jetted off together for our first holiday together as 3 generations and my parents had not been travelling for 20 over years which our last family trip was at Genting Highlands with only me and my parents. 
It was real memorable cos we did Our first DIY baking of cupcakes and Spring Onion Pancakes as a combined effort as 3 generations. And even release our sky lantern with our wishes written. 
My parents had always been reluctant to travel cos of their food stall that they had been conscientiously💪 working hard on to raise us 4kids . They had been really frugal and unwilling to spend much on themselves . So now we are all grown up , i decided to pamper them with this overseas holiday that they can enjoy and looking forward . 
My dad was really elated and he told me he always been wanting to travel but always can’t find time to go due to us , which I really felt bad on not been able to bring her earlier . 
I told my dad I shall bring him and mom more often to travel with us . I could see the glow in his face and now we tried to make it a point to travel yearly to the place they wanted to travel to. 
During the trip, I confessed to him being the youngest daughter I always made him and mom worry . Now being a mom myself I totally understand how it feels and really apologetic for all the rebellious acts and worries that I created for him and never failed to understand them as a working parents whom I always felt neglected . 
He held my hands and told me you are my Daughter and of course I love and care for you. That  really made me teared when I heard his words . Thanks to him for his unwavering love for me and my family that he never give up on me . 
Thankful that with the trip we became a lot closer to each other . 
Thanks @liminal.sg for this generous prize and hope to be the lucky blessed Daughter to win for my dad’s home. 
@layhoontoh @hlgoh.sg @gohsk7676 ❤️😍👍

My late dad is my Hero. He has taught me how to be independent, self-reliant & he has built me to who i am today. He was very strong person, and he would always be there for me and my other siblings whenever we need him. He always puts us family 1st. He was not respected by us his childrens but respected by his friends as well.. He never shy away when anyone approached him for help. He worked very hard to ensure all his children and wife are sufficiently provided & educated. Im missing him very much and will always loves him... Alfateha..🤲 @wattzever @mazafilazum_juniorz

My all time favourite daddy has given me lots of wonderful memories. 
The one which is unforgettable is my dad will always patiently guided me as during my younger days i am a slow learner so he teach and play with me slowly without complaining. He always stand up bravely to support me in everything as i was quiet and slow so everyone bully me. He will always be there for me help me chase everyone who bully me away.
My dad always told me "Be brave in everything and look positive anything you do!!" He always told me to always observe and look around you. Every single thing is important to take note as you will not know what will happen next. 
From young he always taught me to defend and protect myself especially safety as he told me is important wherever you go. A wisdom person who i always remember any single words he told me.
He will look after me no matter how busy he is and given lots of care & support. 
There was once during my younger days i almost die at train station and staff quickly call my dad. My superhero quickly rush from home to the location giving me support to recuse me from death. He will always help those who in need of help no matter how busy he is.
A great and kind man who always treat everybody sincerely. My blessing to have a SuperMan with me as without him i wont be here today. My superman superhero always special to me.
Hope can win this for him as really blessed he is with me till now as almost lost him during my younger days.
❤❤❤❤
Special
Unconditional Love
Patient
Easygoing
Reliable
Magnanimous
Amazing
Noble
❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤
@nel.lamtc @vonzill @sng.ch.7
